result.purpose: This project is a wallet management system designed for handling cryptocurrency transactions and user accounts, integrating various services such as announcements, device management, and external authentication. It aims to provide a secure and efficient platform for users to manage their digital assets and interact with decentralized applications.
result.architecture: The project follows a modular architecture pattern, utilizing a microservices approach with separate modules for handling different functionalities such as routing, services, repositories, and middleware. It employs a combination of RESTful APIs and a web server framework (Echo) for managing HTTP requests and responses.

.github.purpose: Contains templates and configurations for GitHub repository management.
.github.architecture: The folder follows a simple structure for managing GitHub-related templates and configurations, focusing on enhancing collaboration and standardizing contributions.

.github/pull_request_template.md.purpose: Template for pull requests in a GitHub repository

.github/workflows.purpose: This folder is responsible for defining GitHub Actions workflows for various automation tasks related to security checks, Dockerization, linting, and release management.
.github/workflows.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern where each YAML file defines a specific workflow, allowing for separation of concerns and reusability of workflow components.

.github/workflows/check.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for security checks on pull requests to the develop branch.

.github/workflows/dockerize.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for Dockerizing a mobile wallet manager.
side_effects: Triggers Docker build process on specified events
risks: Exposure of sensitive information in secrets

.github/workflows/golangci-lint.yml.purpose: Configuration file for GitHub Actions to run golangci-lint on specified branches.

.github/workflows/sentry.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for Sentry release management.
side_effects: Triggers on release events
risks: Exposure of secrets if not properly managed

cmd/app.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for setting up and running the main application, including an HTTP server and a metrics server.
cmd/app.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where the main application logic is encapsulated in a single entry point (main.go) that initializes and manages various components such as servers and middleware.

cmd/app/main.go.purpose: This file sets up an HTTP server and a metrics server, handling graceful shutdown and middleware integration.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking if enabled
Starts HTTP and metrics servers
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs if not properly configured
Improper handling of shutdown could lead to data loss

cmd/clean_cronjob.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for implementing a cron job that cleans old announcements from a database.
cmd/clean_cronjob.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating the cron job functionality and its dependencies, promoting separation of concerns and maintainability.

cmd/clean_cronjob/main.go.purpose: This file implements a cron job that cleans old announcements from a database.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to PostgreSQL database
Connects to Redis database
Cleans old cron jobs from the database
risks: Potential failure in Sentry initialization
Database connection failures
Error handling may not cover all cases

cmd/clean_highlight_dapps.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for a command-line application that cleans expired highlights from a database.
cmd/clean_highlight_dapps.architecture: The folder follows a command-line application architecture, utilizing a main function to orchestrate the cleaning process, with dependencies on various services for database interactions and error tracking.

cmd/clean_highlight_dapps/main.go.purpose: This file contains the main function for a command-line application that cleans expired highlights from a database.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to PostgreSQL database
Connects to Redis database
Logs information about the cleaning process
risks: Potential failure in Sentry initialization
Database connection failures
Error handling for cleaning highlights may not be comprehensive

cmd/clean_old_special_offers.purpose: Cleans old special offers from a database based on a specified configuration.
cmd/clean_old_special_offers.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating the functionality to clean old special offers into a single executable module with dependencies on external libraries for database interaction and error tracking.

cmd/clean_old_special_offers/main.go.purpose: Cleans old special offers from a database based on a specified configuration.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to a PostgreSQL database
Clears records from the database
risks: Potential database connection failures
Error handling may not cover all edge cases

cmd/ip_location.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for initializing a Sentry client for error tracking and downloading a new IP location database using Redis.
cmd/ip_location.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, focusing on separation of concerns by encapsulating functionalities related to IP location management and error tracking.

cmd/ip_location/main.go.purpose: This file initializes a Sentry client for error tracking and downloads a new IP location database using Redis.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Logs errors and process time
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs
Error handling may not cover all cases

cmd/trigger_announcement.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for initializing a service to trigger announcements based on configuration and database interactions.
cmd/trigger_announcement.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, initializing services and managing dependencies for triggering announcements.

cmd/trigger_announcement/main.go.purpose: This file initializes a service to trigger announcements based on configuration and database interactions.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Establishes a database connection
Triggers an announcement based on environment variable
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information through environment variables
Error handling may not cover all failure cases

config.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for defining and managing application configuration settings.
config.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, separating configuration definitions, initialization logic, and utility functions for managing sensitive data.

config/config.go.purpose: This file defines configuration structures and initializes application settings from a configuration file.
side_effects: Panic if the configuration file cannot be read
Sets global logging level based on configuration
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive configuration data if not handled properly

config/config.yml.purpose: Configuration file for a mobile wallet manager application, defining various settings for services, servers, authentication, logging, and other features.
risks: Exposure of sensitive information due to redacted keys and URLs.
Potential for misconfiguration leading to security vulnerabilities.

config/func_print.go.purpose: This file contains functions to hide sensitive data in configuration structures.
side_effects: Modifies the input data structures to hide sensitive information.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if the hiding functions are not correctly implemented.

config/func_print_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for functions that hide sensitive data in maps and slices.
side_effects: Prints test data to the console
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if not handled properly

database/redis.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for connecting to a Redis database and managing configurations for the connection.
database/redis.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating Redis connection logic and metrics collection in a single file.

database/redis/redis.go.purpose: This file provides functionality to connect to a Redis database and manage configurations for the connection.
side_effects: Logs connection status to Redis server
Registers a Prometheus collector for Redis metrics
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if credentials are logged or mishandled
Insecure TLS configuration if InsecureSkipVerify is set to true

docs.purpose: This folder is responsible for documentation and configuration related to the HTTP client environment settings.
docs.architecture: The folder contains configuration files in a simple structure, focusing on environment settings for the HTTP client.

docs/http-client.env.json.purpose: Configuration file for HTTP client environment settings

handlers.purpose: Responsible for handling various operations related to accounts, announcements, devices, external authentication, and other services within the application.
handlers.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each handler file encapsulates specific functionalities and operations, promoting separation of concerns and maintainability.

handlers/account.go.purpose: Handles account-related operations such as getting account info, linking accounts, refreshing tokens, and revoking tokens.
side_effects: Modifies user account state by linking accounts and refreshing tokens.
Logs debug information.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs.
Improper handling of authentication tokens may lead to security vulnerabilities.

handlers/announcement.go.purpose: Handles announcements and preferences for a service, providing both internal and public API endpoints.

handlers/binance.go.purpose: This file defines a handler for signing requests using the Binance service.

handlers/blacklist.go.purpose: Handles requests related to blacklist sites and returns the blacklist items in JSON format.

handlers/common.go.purpose: This file defines a common handler for managing configurations and code versions in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies cache for common configurations and code versions.
Publishes events to Redis channels.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive configuration data if not properly secured.
Race conditions due to concurrent access to shared resources.

handlers/dapp.go.purpose: This file defines a handler for managing decentralized application (DApp) functionalities, including CRUD operations and public access methods.
side_effects: Modifies the state of the DApp data in the database
Interacts with external services for blacklist checks
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data through improper error handling
Risk of denial of service if the service is overloaded with requests

handlers/default.go.purpose: This file defines a handler function to retrieve agent information from the context.

handlers/device.go.purpose: Handles device-related operations such as resetting devices, registering devices, updating push tokens, syncing addresses, and importing wallets.
side_effects: Logs information about device resets
Asynchronously initializes device registration
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data in logs
Improper error handling could lead to unhandled exceptions

handlers/external_auth.go.purpose: Handles external authentication processes, including exchanging auth codes and revoking tokens.
side_effects: Sends HTTP responses based on authentication results.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive authentication data if not handled properly.

handlers/locationhandler.go.purpose: Handles location-related requests and responses for a web service.
side_effects: Logs debug information when looking up location
risks: Potential exposure of internal service endpoints if not properly secured
Potential exposure of sensitive URL signing information

handlers/network.go.purpose: This file defines a network handler for managing network-related operations in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies cache for DApps and contracts based on user agent information.

handlers/releasecandidate.go.purpose: Handles release candidate features and configurations through HTTP requests.

handlers/trusted_domain.go.purpose: Handles trusted domain operations including retrieval, saving, and deletion of trusted domains.
side_effects: Modifies the state of trusted domains in the database.
Interacts with external services for blacklist checks.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive domain information.
Improper validation may lead to security vulnerabilities.

httpclient.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for defining various HTTP clients for interacting with different services, including Athena, device management, notifications, and tracking.
httpclient.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each file encapsulates a specific client implementation for different services, promoting separation of concerns and reusability.

httpclient/athena.go.purpose: This file defines an HTTP client for interacting with an Athena service, specifically for linking accounts.
side_effects: Makes HTTP requests to an external service
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data in HTTP requests
Error handling may not cover all edge cases

httpclient/device.go.purpose: This file defines a DeviceClient interface and its implementation for managing device-related operations via HTTP requests.
side_effects: Logs a warning if a device address sync is attempted for a non-registered device.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if the SecretKey is not properly managed.

httpclient/internal_client.go.purpose: This file implements an internal HTTP client with HMAC authentication for making requests to a specified URL.
side_effects: Logs request details and errors using zerolog
Modifies HTTP request headers
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if SecretKey is logged or mishandled
Improper error handling may lead to unhandled exceptions

httpclient/mercury.go.purpose: This file defines a MercuryClient interface and its implementation for sending notifications via HTTP.
side_effects: Logs errors when marshaling JSON or creating HTTP requests.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs if errors occur.

httpclient/tracking.go.purpose: This file implements a tracking client for sending tracking requests to a specified URL.
side_effects: Sends HTTP requests to a tracking URL
Performs asynchronous tracking requests
risks: Potential exposure of API key in logs or errors
Asynchronous execution may lead to race conditions if not handled properly

middleware.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for implementing various middleware functions for an Echo web server application, including request tracking, error handling, authentication, and API version checking.
middleware.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each middleware file encapsulates specific functionality related to request processing, enhancing separation of concerns and maintainability.

middleware/custom_requests_total_prometh.purpose: This file defines a middleware for tracking custom HTTP requests using Prometheus metrics.
side_effects: Registers a new Prometheus counter metric
Logs fatal errors if metric registration fails
risks: Potential logging of sensitive user agent information

middleware/error_handler.go.purpose: Handles errors globally for an Echo web server application.
side_effects: Logs error details to the context's logger
Sends JSON response with error details to the client
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive error details in logs
Improper handling of JWT errors may lead to unauthorized access

middleware/internal_auth.go.purpose: This file implements HMAC authentication middleware for validating HMAC signatures in HTTP requests.
side_effects: Modifies HTTP request handling by adding HMAC validation.
risks: Potential for unauthorized access if HMAC validation fails.

middleware/network_api_v1_checking.go.purpose: Defines a middleware function to check if the API version is v1 and sets a context key accordingly.
side_effects: Sets a context key in the echo.Context

middleware/tracking_internal_api.go.purpose: Defines a middleware for tracking API requests in an Echo web framework application.
side_effects: Asynchronously tracks API request data.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive request data in tracking logs.

middleware/user_agent_parsing.go.purpose: This file provides middleware for parsing user agent strings in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies the context with parsed user agent information

middleware/wallet_auth.go.purpose: Middleware for verifying wallet signatures in HTTP requests.
side_effects: Logs request information
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information through logs

migrations.purpose: Responsible for managing database schema changes and data migrations for a blockchain application.
migrations.architecture: The folder follows a versioned migration pattern, where each file represents a specific change to the database schema, allowing for incremental updates and rollbacks.

migrations/20230407150000_init.sql.purpose: Database migration script to create and initialize tables for a blockchain application.
side_effects: Creates database tables and types
Inserts initial data into tables
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not sanitized
Data integrity risks if foreign key constraints are not properly managed

migrations/20231005150000_add_announceme.purpose: This file defines database migrations for creating and dropping tables related to announcements, special offers, and user preferences.
side_effects: Creates tables and indexes in the database
Drops tables if they exist

migrations/20240111120000_alter_preferen.purpose: This file contains migration scripts to alter the preferences table in a database.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema
Changes default values
Creates and drops constraints
risks: Potential data loss during deletion
Integrity issues if constraints are not properly managed

migrations/20240206110000_add_trusted_do.purpose: This file contains database migration scripts to create and drop tables for trusted domains and quick access D apps.
side_effects: Creates tables in the database
Creates an index on a table

migrations/20240410140000_add_dapp_highl.purpose: This file contains migration scripts to modify database schema, including creating extensions, altering tables, and creating indexes.
side_effects: Modifies database schema
Creates indexes which may affect performance
risks: Potential data loss if rollback is not handled properly
Schema changes may affect application functionality

migrations/20240808130000_alter_preferen.purpose: This file contains migration scripts to create and drop an index on the preferences table.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema by adding or removing an index.
risks: Potential performance impact if the index is not used effectively.

models.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for various functionalities related to user accounts, notifications, blockchain interactions, and more.
models.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each file encapsulates related data structures and methods, promoting separation of concerns and reusability.

models/account.go.purpose: Defines request and response structures for user authentication and account linking.

models/announcement.go.purpose: Defines models and methods for handling announcements and notifications.

models/binance.go.purpose: Defines data structures for signing requests and responses for Binance.

models/blacklist.go.purpose: Defines a request structure for getting blacklist sites.

models/chain.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for a blockchain chain model.

models/contract.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for handling smart contract information and metadata.

models/default.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for handling responses and pagination.

models/device.go.purpose: Defines data structures for device management and related requests.

models/external_auth.go.purpose: Defines data structures for handling OAuth authentication requests and responses.

models/highlight.go.purpose: Defines data models and request/response structures for highlights in an application.

models/ip_locations.go.purpose: Defines data structures for IP location information and request handling.

models/moonpay.go.purpose: Defines data structures for Moonpay signing requests and responses.

models/network.go.purpose: Defines the Network model and related request structures for managing blockchain network data.

models/notification.go.purpose: Defines data structures and constants for managing push notifications and their recipients.

models/preference.go.purpose: Defines data models for user preferences and filters related to device preferences.

models/quickaccess.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for managing quick access decentralized applications (DApps).

models/ref_code.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for managing referral codes and wallets.

models/releasecandidate.go.purpose: Defines request structures for feature management in a system.

models/trusted_domain.go.purpose: Defines data models and request structures for managing trusted domains.

models/useragent.go.purpose: Defines a structure for user agent information and provides a method to check if the agent information is empty.

Deletes images from GCS on error

Improper handling of unsupported media types

pkg/announcement/config.go.purpose: Defines configuration structures for an announcement service, including communication, storage, and Kubernetes settings.

pkg/blacklist/service.go.purpose: Provides a service interface for managing blacklisted sites and feature flags based on user agent information.

pkg/crypto/hmac/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for HMAC with normalization of whitelist addresses.

Generates HMAC signatures

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac.go.purpose: Provides functionality for HMAC signature validation with clock skew allowance.

risks: Potential for time-based attacks if clock skew is not properly managed

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for HMAC validation functions, checking clock skew and signature validation.

risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if not handled properly

pkg/crypto/hmac/init.go.purpose: This file initializes a singleton instance of the HMAC structure with a configuration.
side_effects: Initializes a global instance of HMAC
Modifies global configuration
risks: Potential race conditions if InitInstance is called concurrently without proper synchronization

pkg/dapp/d_app_svc.go.purpose: This file defines a service for managing quick access decentralized applications (dApps) and highlights, including CRUD operations and caching mechanisms.

pkg/helper/pointer.go.purpose: Defines a generic function to create a pointer to a value of any type.

repositories.purpose: This folder contains repository definitions for managing various entities in a database, including announcements, code versions, contracts, decentralized applications, highlights, networks, user preferences, quick access DApps, and trusted domains.
repositories.architecture: The folder follows a repository pattern, encapsulating data access logic for different entities and providing a clean interface for CRUD operations.

repositories/announcement.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing announcements, including CRUD operations and special offer logs.
side_effects: Database transactions for creating, updating, and deleting announcements and special offers.

repositories/code_version.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing code versions in a database.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if inputs are not properly sanitized.
Error handling may expose sensitive information.

repositories/common.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing common entities in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if inputs are not properly sanitized.
Data loss if overwriteOnConflict is not handled correctly.

repositories/contract.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing contract data in a database.
side_effects: Database operations such as create, delete, and update contracts.
risks: Potential SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized.
Error handling may expose sensitive information if not managed correctly.

repositories/dapp.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing decentralized applications (DApps) in a database.
side_effects: Database operations such as create, update, delete, and query.
risks: Potential SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized.
Panic calls in unimplemented methods could lead to application crashes.

repositories/highlight.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing highlights in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are performed which may modify the state of the database.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized.
Data integrity issues if concurrent updates are not handled correctly.

repositories/init.go.purpose: Provides pagination functionality for database queries using GORM.
side_effects: Modifies database query parameters based on pagination logic.

repositories/network.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing network entities, including CRUD operations and querying capabilities.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and modified.
risks: Potential SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized.
Panic in SaveNetwork, UpdateNetworks, and SaveNetworks if not implemented.

repositories/preference.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing user preferences in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database operations such as create, update, delete, and query.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized.
Error handling may expose sensitive information.

repositories/quickaccess.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing Quick Access DApps, including CRUD operations and search functionality.
side_effects: Database transactions are performed which may modify the state of the database.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized in search queries.

repositories/trusted_domain.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing trusted domains in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized in queries.

root.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for managing the wallet-manager project, including configuration, documentation, and service definitions.
root.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, organizing configuration, documentation, and service definitions for a Dockerized application.

.golangci.yaml.purpose: Configuration file for GolangCI-Lint, specifying linter settings and rules.

SECURITY.md.purpose: Document the security policy and supported versions of the project.

country_iso2_to_currency.json.purpose: This file maps country ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes to their respective currencies.

country_iso2_to_iso3.json.purpose: This file maps ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes to ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country codes.

docker-compose.yml.purpose: Defines services for a Docker application including PostgreSQL and Redis.
side_effects: Creates Docker containers for PostgreSQL and Redis services.
risks: Exposing database ports may lead to unauthorized access if not properly secured.

entrypoint.sh.purpose: This script serves as an entry point to run a service application.
side_effects: Executes an external application './app' with passed arguments.
risks: Potential execution of untrusted code if './app' is not secure.

routes.purpose: Responsible for setting up and managing routes for a wallet manager API using the Echo web framework.
routes.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, organizing routes into public, private, and internal categories, each handling specific functionalities of the wallet manager API.

routes/init.go.purpose: Sets up routes for an Echo web server and initializes various services and repositories.
side_effects: Logs fatal errors if database client or metrics setup fails
Initializes multiple services and repositories that may affect application state
risks: Potential for SQL injection if inputs are not properly sanitized
Sensitive configuration data may be exposed if not handled securely

routes/internal.go.purpose: Defines internal routes for a wallet manager API, handling various network and announcement functionalities.
side_effects: Modifies the state of the application by registering routes and middleware.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive endpoints if not properly secured.

routes/private.go.purpose: Defines private routes for wallet management including preferences and device operations.

routes/public.go.purpose: Defines public API routes for a wallet manager application, including health checks and various resource endpoints.
side_effects: Modifies the state of the application by registering routes and handlers.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information through API endpoints if not properly secured.

tests.purpose: This folder contains tests for the web server that provides an endpoint to sign messages using ECDSA.
tests.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, focusing on testing the functionality of the web server with a clear separation of concerns.

tests/main.go.purpose: This file implements a web server that provides an endpoint to sign messages using ECDSA.
side_effects: Starts an HTTP server
Listens for OS interrupt signals to gracefully shut down the server
risks: Potential exposure of private keys if not handled securely
Logging sensitive information (e.g., errors) may lead to information leakage
